emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Evolution
emerging_technologies.description: AI-driven tools that autonomously evolve software by understanding requirements, writing code, and suggesting optimizations, improving efficiency and reducing human error.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential job displacement in coding professions, necessitating reskilling and adaptation in the workforce. Ethical concerns regarding AI-driven software decision-making and accountability.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ease of integration into existing development workflows, reliability of AI-generated code, and regulatory acceptance of AI-authored software.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Cryptography
emerging_technologies.description: Development of cryptographic algorithms resistant to quantum computing attacks, ensuring data security in a post-quantum world.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances data security but requires widespread adoption to prevent vulnerabilities in existing systems. Potential for new cybersecurity arms race.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Need for standardization, integration into existing protocols, and the urgency to prevent quantum breaches.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace Interface
emerging_technologies.description: A neural interface technology that integrates directly with the brain, enabling thought-controlled computing and enhanced cognitive capabilities.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical concerns about privacy, identity, and potential for misuse. Could revolutionize communication, education, and entertainment, but also poses risks of social inequality.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological breakthroughs in neuroscience, regulatory approval, and public acceptance of invasive brain-computer interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Planning
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that design and manage urban spaces, optimizing for efficiency, sustainability, and quality of life based on real-time data and predictive analytics.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to more efficient cities but raises questions about loss of human oversight, accountability, and potential for AI-driven gentrification.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Integration with existing urban infrastructure, regulatory frameworks, and public trust in AI urban planning decisions.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Assisted Healthcare
mainstream_technologies.description: AI tools that assist in diagnosis, treatment planning, and patient management, enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of healthcare delivery.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in hospitals and clinics, with regulatory frameworks in place to ensure ethical use and data privacy.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain-based Digital Identity
mainstream_technologies.description: A decentralized system for managing digital identities, ensuring privacy, security, and control over personal data.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard for online verification, with increasing integration into financial services, healthcare, and government systems.

epoch_themes.description: The era where AI, automation, and neural interfaces accelerate, leading to significant shifts in how work, education, and human interaction are conducted.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Transformative effects on employment, privacy, and human augmentation. Potential for increased productivity but also for societal disruption.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global competition in AI development, ethical debates on AI regulation, and a push for education reform to adapt to AI-driven economies.

epoch_themes.description: The need for security in the face of quantum computing, leading to the development and adoption of quantum-resistant technologies.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Ensures data privacy and security in a quantum world, with implications for global cybersecurity and data protection laws.
epoch_themes.global_trends: International cooperation on cryptographic standards, acceleration of cybersecurity research, and integration with emerging blockchain technologies.
